publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2393.1 David Whitton: Congratulating Pakistan and India on 61 Years of Independenceâ€”As an amendment to motion (S3M-2393) in the name of Bashir Ahmad, leave out from "and Pakistan for" to end and insert ", leading the way in many fields of science, technology, mathematics, commerce and trade, and Pakistan for its flourishing research institutes, such as the Applied Economics Research Centre in Karachi and the National Centre of Excellence in Geology in Peshawar; notes and celebrates the extensive contribution of Indians and Pakistanis living in Scotland; recognises that the road to independence was not always smooth, with the largest and most rapid population transfer in history, with an estimated 20 million people leaving their homes; also recognises the loss of life, notably the Jallianwala Bagh massacre, among the non-cooperation movements and during the salt march and civil disobedience; applauds the significant steps both countries have taken in working closer with one another, and wishes them both continued success in the years to come." Supported by: Bashir Ahmad*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Ken Macintosh*, Des McNulty*
S3M-2393.1Congratulating Pakistan and India on 61 Years of Independence (lodged on 15 August 2008) Dr Richard Simpson*, Elaine Murray*, Iain Gray*, Sarah Boyack*
S3M-2393.1 Congratulating Pakistan and India on 61 Years of Independence (lodged on 15 August 2008) Cathy Peattie*
